frame.name: Proper_reference
frame.definition:
<def-root>A speaker marks explicitly that he intends to describe an <fen>Entity</fen> in a more restricted sense than it was used in the immediately preceding discourse, and that therefore his <fen>Intended_referent</fen> is different from the one that the hearer might have picked out based on the way the <fen>Entity</fen> label was previously used.
<ex>Of these, nowadays there are 308 within the <fex name="Entity">city</fex> <t>proper</t>, and 534 if suburbs are included.</ex> <ex>Of these, nowadays there are 308 within <fex name="Intended_referent">the city PROPER</fex>, and 534 if suburbs are included.</ex>
<ex>The writing in the WSJ is always excellent, with the majority of its writing staff located in <fex name="Entity">New York</fex> <t>proper</t>.</ex> <ex>The writing in the WSJ is always excellent, with the majority of its writing staff located in <fex name="Intended_referent">New York PROPER</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Israel Radio said Israel would turn over the <fex name="Entity">town</fex> <t>itself</t>, while agreeing to resume discussions over the surrounding villages in two weeks.</ex> <ex>Israel Radio said Israel would turn over <fex name="Intended_referent">the town ITSELF</fex>, while agreeing to resume discussions over the surrounding villages in two weeks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The name of a particular entity that otherwise might be interpreted as having a broader reference.
<ex>Private quarters are in the <fex name="Entity">tower</fex> <t>proper</t> with a chapel at the very top</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Intended_referent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that the speaker intends to refer to using the <fen>Entity</fen> in a more restricted sense. The <fen>Intended_referent</fen> is typically a part of the referent that the hearer might have identified based on the broader use of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>The gatehouse providing entry from the outer defences to <fex name="int">the Castle PROPER</fex> was erected by King James III and originally formed part of a splendid fore-front .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: self.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: used to emphasize a particular thing, person, or group already mentioned.
